Corporate America is at it again — twisting a retail shopping survey into a pro–Return to Office propaganda piece and hoping no one notices. In this video, I expose how an article claims "Gen Z loves the office"… based on the opinions of 125 Gen Z respondents in a study about in-store shopping. Yep — apparently liking to touch a sweater before you buy it means you can’t wait to get back under fluorescent lighting.

I break down exactly how the CMO behind this “study” cherry-picks stats, ignores context, and misleads rea
title: I JUST CAUGHT CORPORATE LYING ABOUT RTO! (AGAIN!)
